title: Thomas Tuchel wants 'important' Edinson Cavani to stay at PSG
text:
PSG boss Thomas Tuchel believes Edinson Cavani is crucial to the club, talking amid rumours that the Uruguayan is set to leave at the end of his contract, according to Goal.

Cavani's current deal runs until the end of the season, and he has been linked with a move away from Parc des Princes.

Tuchel was asked about Cavani's future at a press conference, as it appears the forward is still yet to sign a new deal with PSG.

Edinson Cavani's contract runs out at the end of the season, and has been linked with an exit

However, PSG boss Thomas Tuchel wants him to stay, saying he is 'very important' at the club

'It's too soon to speak about such things. I'm sure Edi is speaking with the club. He knows it's his club.'

Cavani is currently out of action with a hip injury, just one name on a long list of PSG players sidelined, which includes Neymar.

'I don't know Edi's ideas exactly at the moment. I count 100 per cent on Edi this season. He's been missing for several weeks and the main thing for me is to push Edi on the pitch, so we've got a fit and in-form Edinson Cavani.

'He's got the most goals for the club. Edi is very important,' Tuchel continued.

'He's in the group of five players I always speak with, to have an opinion from them on all things. He's important in the dressing room and on the pitch.'

Cavani has been a lethal striker for PSG, scoring an impressive 195 goals in 283 games

Since joining in 2013, Cavani has played 283 games for PSG, scoring an impressive 195 goals.

There has been interest from Manchester United, but he is also reported to be joining Juventus on a free transfer when his contract runs out, with Mario Mandzukic tipped to leave.

With the arrival of Mauro Icardi, PSG bosses may be more willing to let the 32-year-old go.
